definition: "The Ugly Duckling" by Hans Christian Andersen 安徒生[An1 tu2 sheng1]

sentences.english: The little ugly duck murmured while walked, suddenly a courser scurried out.
sentences.chinese: 醜小鴨邊走邊說，突然，一直獵狗竄了出來。

sentences.english: And he went away without touching the Ugly Duckling.
sentences.chinese: 然後他沒有碰醜小鴨一下就走了。

sentences.english: Her ugly-duckling narrative proved irresistible to reality-TV fans.
sentences.chinese: 她醜小鴨般的故事在這現實的電視節目中被驗證。

sentences.english: The Ugly Duckling Goes to Work is more entertaining than most books on business.
sentences.chinese: 醜小鴨開始行動比大多數有關商業的書都更有趣。

sentences.english: My sister was an ugly duckling.
sentences.chinese: 我的妹妹以前是個醜小鴨。

sentences.english: My mother once called me an ugly duckling.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽曾經叫我醜小鴨。

sentences.english: The Ugly Duckling also jumped in the water and swam very well.
sentences.chinese: 這隻醜小鴨也跳進了水，而且水遊的很好。

sentences.english: Finally, the pond froze, and the duckling couldn't move any more.
sentences.chinese: 最後，池塘結冰了，醜小鴨被凍住了。

sentences.english: The butterfly is really among the swan-ugly duckling school of butterflies.
sentences.chinese: 這種蝴蝶可真是蝴蝶家族中醜小鴨變天鵝的一員了。

sentences.english: Ugly is not ugly. He is a very beautiful swan.
sentences.chinese: 醜小鴨一點也不醜，它是一直非常漂亮的小天鵝。

sentences.english: "The ugly duckling can swim very well, " thinks the mother duck.

definition: lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
amphibious/dual-talented/able to work in two different lines
